name: Peter Hennessey

roles_in_work.title: My Woomera Project (What do you fear?)

biography:
Peter Hennessey is an artist whose work encompasses sculpture, video and interactive media.  In 1994, with artist Patricia Piccinini, he initiated The Basement Project, an artist-run-space in Melbourne that ran until 1997.  Hennessey graduated in Architecture from RMIT in 1995 and with Piccinini, founded Drome.  Drome is a studio dedicated to providing a context and support for artists to make contemporary art and a producer of collaborative projects with artists and arts organisations.

Hennessey's exhibitions include: Repercussions, Greenaway Art Gallery, Adelaide, as part of the Adelaide Festival (2004); and Closer, a collaboration with the dance company Chunky Move, which was shown at the Perth Festival (2004), ACMI (2003), and the Performance Space, Sydney (2003).  In 2002 his work was included in Akhihabara TV in Tokyo.  LumpCD, a Drome project, was completed in 1999 and has been exhibited in galleries and festivals in the Netherlands, Japan and Australia.

Taken from the PROOF exhibition 2004.
